official-title.#text:
Condemning any proposals for the arbitrary
		  seizure of funds from federally insured deposit accounts in the United States
		  by the Government without due process.

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the following
			 resolution; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
condemns
			 any proposals for the arbitrary seizure of funds from federally insured deposit
			 accounts in the United States by the Government without due process.

text.#text:
Whereas such proposals have incited public panic and
			 raised concerns that large numbers of bank customers may withdraw funds from
			 their depository institutions rapidly and simultaneously, also known as

Whereas such proposals have resulted in temporary capital
			 restrictions and bank closures in fear of prolonged bank runs;

Whereas such proposals have resulted in bank customers
			 unable to withdraw funds during normal bank operating hours;

Whereas federally insured deposit accounts help maintain
			 public confidence in the U.S. financial system;

Whereas a financial transaction tax or fee also would be
			 detrimental to average investors in towns all across America, suppress business
			 activity, and harm the U.S. economy from Main Street to Wall Street: Now,
			 therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 166 IH: Condemning any proposals for the arbitrary seizure of funds from federally insured deposit accounts in the United States by the Government without due process.
